tool.name: qiime2 fragment-insertion sepp
tool.description: Insert fragment sequences using SEPP into reference phylogenies.

param.name: representative_sequences
param.label: representative_sequences: FeatureData[Sequence]
param.help: [required] The sequences to insert into the reference tree.

param.name: reference_database
param.label: reference_database: SeppReferenceDatabase
param.help: [required] The reference database to insert the representative sequences into.

param.name: alignment_subset_size
param.label: alignment_subset_size: Int
param.help: [default: 1000] Each placement subset is further broken into subsets of at most these many sequences and a separate HMM is trained on each subset.

param.name: placement_subset_size
param.label: placement_subset_size: Int
param.help: [default: 5000] The tree is divided into subsets such that each subset includes at most these many subsets. The placement step places the fragment on only one subset, determined based on alignment scores. Further reading: https://github.com/smirarab/sepp/blob/master/tutorial/sepp-tutorial.md#sample-datasets-default-parameters.

param.name: threads
param.label: threads: Int
param.help: [default: 1] The number of threads to use.

param.name: debug
param.label: debug: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Collect additional run information to STDOUT for debugging. Temporary directories will not be removed if run fails.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: fragment-insertion sepp ================================ Insert fragment sequences using SEPP into reference phylogenies.
Outputs: -------- :tree.qza: The tree with inserted feature data. :placements.qza: Information about the feature placements within the reference tree.
|
Description: ------------ Perform fragment insertion of sequences using the SEPP algorithm.
|
